segments.text: Yes , please . I've been here for nearly two months , but I still haven ’ t found a job . Do you think you can find one for me ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Don ’ t worry , we ’ ll try to help you . Will you please fill out this form ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: This is for registration . After you have given us your personal details , we'll match these against new jobs as they come in . And we ’ ll contact you when there is a job that suits you .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That's great . But how long do I have to wait ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Maybe several weeks , maybe several months . It's hard to tell .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , dear . How can I wait for such a long time ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Actually , many jobs are filled by people who select vacancies from the display boards there .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Then , what do you think I should do ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: My advice is to keep looking for jobs yourself . Check the job boards at the job center regularly and check the newspapers daily . If you have friends or relatives here , ask them for help , too .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I see . Thank you very much for your advice . Bye .
segments.speaker: S2
